alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for bikes lent or hired to staff
body:
$!As an employer, lending or hiring bikes to employees doesn't count as an expense or benefit - as long as they're available to all employees and mainly used for getting to work.$!

This means:

+ you don’t have to report them to HMRC
+ you don’t deduct or pay tax and National Insurance on them

##Technical guidance

The following guide contains more detailed information:

+ [particular benefits: exemption for bicycles](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim21664.htm "Particular benefits: exemption for bicycles"){:rel="external"}

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers lending or hiring bicycles to employees
